content: free the minis scarf amy meeks design ravelry indigoamy instagram @inkedindigo materials 180 gm fingering weight yarn total weight 4-5gm fingering weight yarn per 7 stripe sequence us 4/3 5 mm needles 4 dpns 9 inch circular needle or 32 inch cord for magic loop method 1 stitch marker tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations k knit ca color a cb color b cc color c cd color d gauge not important but approximately 15 stitches/2 inches unblocked in stockinette stitch notes stripes are made up of two rounds of stockinette stitch yarn ends are woven in while knitting then carried between stripes to prevent having to weave in a million ends youtube has some great videos showing how to weave in ends as you knit directions provisionally cast on 84 stitches in ca 28 stitches on 3 dpns 42 stitches on each needle for magic loop k all stitches and join in round being careful not to twist place stitch marker for beginning of round k one more round in ca k all stitches in cb for 2 rounds repeat 2 rounds in ca then 2 rounds in cb until you have 4 stripes in ca now begin striping sequence dropping ca and adding cc k a total of 7 stripes in cb before dropping cb and adding cd repeat alternating stripes dropping old color after 7 stripes then adding new color for 7 stripes k to approx 58-59 inches use scrap yarn to pull through the last round do not bind off yet block flat with beginning of round as one edge this will hide stripe jog in yarns block to 61-65 inches in length 5-6 inches wide once dry kitchener live stitches at beginning and end of scarf wrap twice around your neck free your minis all rights reserved by amy meeks permission required for use other than personal
